bill_title: provide for the funding of certain reduced tuition programs for veterans.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the funding of certain reduced tuition programs for veterans and teachers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-55 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any veteran who is eligible for free tuition pursuant to § 13-55-2 who is enrolled, at a self- supporting off-campus institution, in any undergraduate course under the control and management of the Board of Regents not subsidized by the general fund is entitled to a benefit of one hundred percent of the in-state resident tuition to be paid to the institution by the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs. The veteran shall pay to the institution any tuition charge in excess of the in-state resident tuition. Section 2. That chapter 13-55 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any teacher or instructor who is eligible for reduced tuition pursuant to § 13-55-24 who is enrolled, at a self-supporting off-campus institution, in any undergraduate course under the control and management of the Board of Regents not subsidized by the general fund is entitled to a benefit of fifty percent of the in-state resident tuition to be paid to the institution by the Department of Education. The teacher or instructor shall pay to the institution any tuition charge in excess of fifty percent of the in-state resident tuition. Section 3. That § 13-55-23 be amended to read as follows: 13-55-23. Notwithstanding any other provisions of law Unless another funding source is specified , legislatively mandated exemptions, whether whole or partial, from the obligation to pay tuition or other required fees apply only to classes, courses and instructional programs directly supported by moneys appropriated from the general fund.

That chapter 13-55 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any veteran who is eligible for free tuition pursuant to § 13-55-2 who is enrolled, at a self- supporting off-campus institution, in any undergraduate course under the control and management of the Board of Regents not subsidized by the general fund is entitled to a benefit of one hundred percent of the in-state resident tuition to be paid to the institution by the Board of Regents. The veteran shall pay to the institution any self-support off-campus tuition charge in excess of the in-state resident tuition. Section 2. That § 13-55-23 be amended to read as follows: 13-55-23. Notwithstanding any other provisions of law Except as otherwise provided by law , legislatively mandated exemptions, whether whole or partial, from the obligation to pay tuition or other required fees apply only to classes, courses and instructional programs directly supported by moneys appropriated from the general fund.

The veteran shall pay to the institution any self-support off-campus tuition charge in excess of the in-state resident tuition. Section 2. That § 13-55-23 be amended to read as follows: 13-55-23. Notwithstanding any other provisions of law As provided in section 1 of this Act , legislatively mandated exemptions, whether whole or partial, from the obligation to pay tuition or other required fees apply only to classes, courses and instructional programs directly supported by moneys appropriated from the general fund.
